intro: Roettlera pedicellata, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and opposite, and it thrives in warm, sunny environments. Roettlera pedicellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
